text: We've added woody material to a stretch of the Cray, a precious chalk stream in #Bexley -  as part of  our work restoring an 800m stretch to boost the rivers' health, in p/ship with @EnovertCT, @LBofBexley & @EnvAgency. Read more: https://t.co/WRUFxrKXsn https://t.co/VLAIFpR4nc

urls.title: Precious chalk stream in Bexley gets health boost - Thames21
urls.description: Bexley residents and local wildlife can now enjoy a healthier river Cray where it flows through Foots Cray Meadows, Bexley.Waterways charity Thames21 has carried out restoration work on an 800m stretch of the river

@fayedavies @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe Its time to take the pieceful protest to Dave Jones doorstep. Lives in out the area in a nice leafy location, with no smell. Time to up the pressure on the shit Councillor who cared so much he wanted to be the Moorlands MP.

Time to force the shit like him out of Labour.

@Newcast42068272 @StinkStopthe @88si888 @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC The EA are complicit in all of this mess, if you read the reports that they and RED have produced this issue of increased tonnage being authorised is key. Don‚Äôt forget RED tried to bully the MP, I wonder what their relationship is with the EA? Where there is muck there is money!

@fayedavies @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL Do you work at Keele by any chance with the rest of the shit house Labour Councillors who all live in leafy areas, do fuck all and have driven the Labour Party into a wet rag that even voted against the Councils budget to spend the money to handle the calls etc.

@88si888 @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @NewsNBC Word has it that the Labour Councillors knew this and said nothing. Again why would they as they all live in leafy Keele and only care about their own interests
